channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Intel wants to make chips for automakers to help with the global shortage
item.description: Intel has laid out a plan to help automakers dealing with the global semiconductor shortage that has left companies like GM canceling production shifts.

item.title: Google's Nest Audio smart speaker is 20 percent off across the web
item.description: Google's Nest Audio is on sale for $20 off at many online retailers, including Best Buy and Walmart.

item.title: Apple's iPad mini drops to $345 at Amazon
item.description: Save big the iPad mini -- Apple's tiny tablet is $55 off at Amazon right now.

item.title: Netflix is working on a live-action Gundam movie
item.description: Kong: Skull Island's Jordan Vogt-Roberts will produce and direct the film.

item.title: Facebook starts displaying state by state vaccination notifications
item.description: Facebook plans to start rolling out notifications to connect people to state-specific information from their local health departments about how they can get vaccinated.

item.title: NVIDIA unveils pro-level Ampere GPUs for workstations
item.description: NVIDIA isn't letting gamers have all the fun. Today at its GTC conference, the company announced its next round of professional-focused graphics cards, based on the Ampere architecture first scene with its RTX 30-series GPUs.

item.title: NVIDIA's Drive Atlan chip is headed to cars in 2025
item.description: NVIDIA detailed its next-generation Atlan Drive chip at its GTC keynote, promising a processor that will deliver 1,000 TOPS of performance.

item.title: Apple ditches its ‘far beyond HDR’ claim for the Pro Display XDR in the UK
item.description: The Advertising Standards Authority reportedly asked the company to stop using the phrase.

item.title: NVIDIA and MediaTek want to bring RTX graphics to ARM laptops
item.description: What would an ARM-based laptop look like with an RTX graphics card? That's something NVIDIA is exploring together with MediaTek, a company best known for building ARM-based chips.

item.title: NVIDIA's Grace, its first datacenter CPU, is another major threat to Intel
item.description: Just like Apple did with its M1 chip, NVIDIA is taking on Intel directly with its own Arm-based CPU.

item.title: Uber says March was its biggest month ever
item.description: According to The Wall Street Journal, Uber had a record March, with gross bookings hitting their highest-ever level in the company's history. Uber also said that demand has recovered faster than driver availability — something that means you might be paying a surge price or waiting a little bit for a car when you need one.

item.title: GM's Cruise will operate a robotaxi service in Dubai
item.description: Cruise has struck a deal to operate a robotaxi service in Dubai in 2023 — the first time it will offer commercial self-driving service outside of the US.

item.title: Uber, PayPal and Walgreens set up a Vaccine Access Fund
item.description: Anyone can donate and help to cover the cost of rides to COVID-19 vaccination sites.

item.title: Watch NVIDIA's GTC 2021 keynote here at 11:30AM ET
item.description: NVIDIA is holding its GTC keynote at 11:30AM ET, and it's poised to share news on graphics, self-driving car technology and more.

item.title: Get lifetime access to Startups.com Unlimited for just $50
item.description: With Startups.com Unlimited, you'll get access to hundreds of in-depth courses, on-demand expert help, innovative software and more.

item.title: Domino’s starts making autonomous pizza deliveries
item.description: Houston residents might receive their pizza from Nuro’s R2.

item.title: Intel's Mobileye will power driverless 'last-mile' deliveries starting in 2023
item.description: Intel's self-driving technology company Mobileye has just announced a partnership with Udelv to build a fleet of autonomous delivery vehicles.

item.title: Apple is reportedly working on a speaker with Apple TV built in
item.description: Apple is reportedly developing two smart home devices with premium audio features.

item.title: DJI's Osmo Pocket gimbal camera is 46 percent off at B&H Photo
item.description: Save big on DJI's Osmo Pocket gimbal camera at B&H Photo.

item.title: Topps debuts its first NFT baseball card collection
item.description: Topps has released its first NFT baseball card collection, Series 1, bringing MLB cards into the digital era.

item.title: Microsoft will acquire speech-tech giant Nuance for $19.7 billion
item.description: Nuance already works with Microsoft on its Healthcare Cloud, now it'll be part of Microsoft's cloud business entirely.

item.title: The Morning After: Sony plans to bring its hit PlayStation series to smartphones
item.description: Today’s headlines: Alibaba hit with $2.8 billion fine in China antitrust case, Sony plans to bring its hit PlayStation series to smartphones and NASA delays Mars helicopter flight to at least April 14th.

item.title: Amazon's rotating Echo Show 10 drops to a new low price of $200
item.description: Amazon is offering its premium Echo Show 10 smart screen for $50 less as part of an all-time low deal on the Alexa-powered device.

item.title: Ducati backs away from electric motorcycle production plans
item.description: After saying in 2019 that it was "not far from starting production" on an electric motorcyle, Ducati is doing a U-turn on those plans.

item.title: Apple's 512GB MacBook Air M1 falls to an all-time low on Amazon
item.description: Amazon is currently offering the 512GB MacBook Air with Apple's latest M1 chipset for $1,149.
